Package io.avery.vinyl

Class SelectAPI.Window

java.lang.Object
io.avery.vinyl.SelectAPI.Window
Enclosing class:
SelectAPI
public class SelectAPI.Window extends Object
A sub-configurator used to define fields of a select operation in terms of analytic functions over partitions of the input stream.

A window may define zero or more keys, that together group the input stream into non-overlapping partitions. Each partition will capture one or more input records, each of which corresponds to exactly one output record.

A window may define fields as analytic functions. An analytic function is applied per-partition, and emits one value per input record in the partition, which becomes the value of the field on the corresponding output record from the partition. Alternatively, an analytic function may emit just one value for the partition, which becomes the value of the field on all output records from the partition.

See Also:
  • SelectAPI.window(Consumer)

    • field

      public <T> SelectAPI.Window field(Field<T> field, Comparator<? super Record> comparator, BiConsumer<? super List<Record>,? super Consumer<T>> mapper)
      Defines (or redefines) the given field in terms of the given analytic function, applied to input records in each partition.

      The function is called with a non-empty, unmodifiable list of input records and a consumer of field values. The function must call the consumer exactly once, or once per record in the partition; otherwise an IllegalStateException will be thrown during evaluation. If the consumer is called once, the value passed to it will be assigned to the field on all output records from the partition. If the consumer is called multiple times, each value passed to it will be assigned to the field on the next output record, in ordered correspondence with the input records (as ordered by the given comparator, if any).

      A comparator may be provided to sort input records in the partition prior to applying the analytic function. Some analytic functions may depend on this for proper ordered correspondence. If the comparator is null, input records are left unsorted.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the value type of the field
      Parameters:
      field - the field
      comparator - a comparator used to sort the input records in the partition before applying the function. May be null, in which case input records are left unsorted.
      mapper - an analytic function to be applied to input records in each partition
      Returns:
      this configurator

    • keys

      public SelectAPI.Window keys(Field<?>... fields)
      Defines keys from each of the given fields, as the lookup of the same field on each input record.
      Parameters:
      fields - the fields
      Returns:

      Throws:

    • keys

      public <T> SelectAPI.Window keys(Function<? super Record,? extends T> mapper, Consumer<SelectAPI.Window.Keys<T>> config)
      Configures a sub-configurator, that may define keys in terms of the result of applying the given function to each input record. If no keys are defined by the sub-configurator, the entire sub-configurator is discarded.
      Type Parameters:

      Parameters:
      mapper - a function to be applied to each input record
      config - a consumer of the sub-configurator
      Returns:
      this configurator

    • fields

      public <T> SelectAPI.Window fields(Comparator<? super Record> comparator, Function<? super List<Record>,? extends T> mapper, Consumer<SelectAPI.Window.Fields<T>> config)
      Configures a sub-configurator, that may define (or redefine) fields in terms of analytic functions that take as input the result of applying the given function to input records in each partition. The function is called with a non-empty, unmodifiable list of input records. Enclosed analytic functions follow the same "once or once-per-record" emission rules as usual, even if size information is not preserved by the given function's result.

      A comparator may be provided to sort input records in the partition prior to applying the given function. Some enclosed analytic functions may depend on this for proper ordered correspondence. If the comparator is null, input records are left unsorted.

      If no fields are defined by the sub-configurator, possibly due to later field redefinitions, the entire sub-configurator is discarded.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the result type of the function
      Parameters:
      comparator - a comparator used to sort the input records in the partition before applying the function, or any enclosed analytic functions. May be null, in which case input records are left unsorted.
      mapper - a function to be applied to input records in each partition
      config - a consumer of the sub-configurator
      Returns:
      this configurator
      See Also:
      • field(Field, Comparator, BiConsumer)
